cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles SE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the Yucatan Peninsula this weekend, then turning north-northwest over the central Gulf toward the north-western Gulf Coast (TX/LA) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas or southwest Louisiana coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Punta Herrero to Cancún, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Punta Herrero to Dzilam, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, gusts higher) possible late Tuesday into Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft surge possible along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and approaches to Houston Ship Channel
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce 4–8 inches with localized higher totals, causing flash flooding in the Houston metro and port facilities
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas (10–15 ft) in the approaches, possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands; port operations may face berth closures and crane restrictions
